subject: the best laid plans
event:
Forgive the brevity of this.  I am not feeling so well at the moment, and don't have the energy for a long post.

I am going to have to cancel out on the pizza crawl.

I am still in Boston as I write, and may or may not be moving on to New Haven.  Boskone was a lot of fun right up until last Sunday night, when I came down with . . . well, Parris thinks it's a stomach virus, and I'm thinking it's just plain old fashioned food poisoning.  I blame a bad shrimp.

Whatever the cause, I've spent the last day and a half running between my bed and the bathroom.  The worst is over, I think, but I'm still pretty weak, my stomach is very tender, and I seem to have lost my sense of smell.  None of which bodes well for a day of eating pizza.

I am bitterly disappointed to have to post this.  As sick as I felt yesterday, I have been hoping that by today I'd be back to my old self.  I have been looking forward to this pizza crawl for weeks,

My sincere apologies to anyone who gets this message too late, and shows up in New Haven to meet me.  If I could be there, I would be.

I still hope to have recovered in time to make all my scheduled appearances at the New York City comicon... but just now, nothing is certain.

comments.article: oh dear. *spanks the shrimp* I hope you'll get better soon. Gripes in the guts are always... yuck.

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: pic#124268277
comments.article:
I was just thinking, I hope you haven't been eating any Peter Pan peanut butter.

Feel better soon.

you didn't by chance accept any drinks from a dwarf with mismatched eyes answering to the name Tyrion, did you?

kidding aside, hope you feel better. soon.

That totally kicked off my day in the best possible way. Hahaha.

Hope you get better in time for the con, George. What a shame about the pizza crawl.
I am sure that New Haven will still have pizza in the future. Hope you feel better.
I agree, the pizza will still be here for another time.  Who knows, maybe  a few more places will open up too. ^^ Hope you get better soon.
comments.subject: the pizza's not going anywhere

comments.article: Best wishes for a quick recovery!
Get well soon George - stomach viruses / food poisoning are hell. :(
How awful! Food poisoning is naaaasty. Rest well, and hang in there - I hope you feel better soon!
The stomach bug... yikes.  If it's the wild card you drew, I'm hoping that it's an ACE!
I hope it really is just a stomach virus and not a norovirus or e. coli.  The former's been going around down here and there's not much you can do in any case.  Good luck and above all stay hydrated!
love your icon.  Is that caffeine? :)
Oh yuck, stomach bugs are the worst. :( Feel better soon!
If you need absolutely anything, George, give me a call. Parris has my cell number.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: horns
comments.article:
I blame a bad shrimp.
It's not my fault! I blame one of my cousins on the distaff side.

All joking aside, I wish you a speedy recovery. It was great to see you and Parris again, and hopefully I'll be able to find you and Daniel Abraham in the madness that is NYComicon.
You know that we all KNOW you are the shrimp in question, so don't bother denying it.
Ditto on the quick recovery, George!

I had the stomach bug Sunday, going into Monday.  I tried to get as much rest as possible yesterday so I could drag my sorry ass to New Haven today.  I'm still not feeling 100%.  Now, I can get back to resting for when the Pizza Crawl is resurrected!!
comments.subject: Whew. . .

comments.article: Um.  I think this crawl wasn't canceled.  It's just that Martin won't be there.
comments.subject: Re: Whew. . .

comments.article: Hope you feel better soon.  Stomach virus/food poisoning is never fun.
Best wishes for a speedy recovery.  Lots of water and rest.

I've sent out an e-mail to as many people as I could (hopefully).

I still plan to leave my place at 2:30 and head to Pepe's and Modern to make sure that people know the bad news.

:(
-Zen Blade (Dennis)
comments.subject: CANCELLATION:  e-mail and pizza

comments.article: Get well soon!  *hands you some soup and a grilled cheese sandwich*
Feel better *hugs*

Well, I hope you feel better soon.  It's disappointing that we won't all get to go crawling today, but with any luck you'll feel your old self the next time you're going to be in the area, and will feel in the mood to invite us all to the pizza crawl / take 2.
Get well soon!
Feel better!  New Haven and their pizza will still be there the next time you're in the area.
Get well! I had a stomach virus in January and even for a few days after the worst was over I was in no mood to eat any more than absolutely necessary.

I don't have an LJ account, so please bear with me if I violate any rules of posting.

I'd like to apologize for the cancellation of the pizza crawl, but George is just too dang sick to travel today, let alone indulge in the greasy goodness of many slices. He tried to get up and prepare for travel this morning, but he's just too weak. He feels very guilty that there's so many folks who were looking forward to this evening and he's been felled by a mere virus.

If he doesn't get notably better by this afternoon, don't worry, I will have the hotel send a doctor up to check him out.

I promise the next time he's in this part of the country he'll do his best to re-organize the Pizza Crawl.

If you have any contact information for other people who were planning on coming to the crawl, please let them know immediately of the cancellation. I know there were people coming from far and wide, and I would hate for them to get to New Haven and find no other GRRM/pizza fans waiting outside the Modern or whatever.

We were both looking forward to meeting more friends, and enjoying many slices of great pizza, and send our apologies and regrets to all.

Parris
comments.subject: this is Parris

comments.article:
Well, thanks to you and your husband for even coming up with this wonderful idea of fans and their favorite author to meet face-to-face in such an informal setting. While we are certainly disappointed, we are equally hopeful for his speedy recovery and the next time he is in the New Haven area. Hopefully, Sally's will be open for the much-anticpated event.

Thanks again to you and your husband.

EHRothauser@aol.com
comments.subject: Re: this is Parris
